item.title: Store Locator
item.dc:creator: user
item.content:encoded:
Ukrop’s Homestyle Foods brand products are available in retail stores across 30 states. Below is a list of national and large regional retailers where you can find them. Use our Store Locator to find our products in stores near you.
Visit our storefront on Amazon to purchase available brand products online.

wp:postmeta.wp:meta_value: Nourishing families and communities is at the heart of what we do.
Explore fresh prepared meals and sides, baked goods and desserts, available both in-store and online. (Don’t browse while hungry!)
Family gathering, business luncheon, small army: if you have a group, we can feed them. Pickup and delivery is available across metro Richmond.
Special occasions call for sweet treats. Our bakers and decorators are on call to handcraft and design your extra special dessert.
For 80 years, Ukrop’s has been the name families trust for wholesome foods and quality service. It’s always a pleasure to serve you.

item.title: Careers
item.dc:creator: user
item.content:encoded:
Thank you for your interest in joining our dynamic team.

  Making fresh and delicious foods, our company has the opportunity to have a profound influence on the lives of those who work for our company, supply and/or make purchases from our company, and those who enjoy our food. We’re proud that our products encourage families to gather around the table. We are looking for passionate and qualified associates. If you are interested in employment with our company in Richmond, Virginia, please review our open positions below. Applicants should submit a resume (in MS Word or .pdf format) and supporting documentation to careers@ukropshomestylefoods.com.

wp:postmeta.wp:meta_value: Get tips on feeding your busy family, easy entertaining ideas, simple meal solutions and ways to bring your family and friends together with delicious food.

item.title: The Ukrop's Story
item.dc:creator: user
item.content:encoded:
Ukrop’s Super Market was a special place — one that cared about the community and people, and the experiences they had each time they visited the store. Ukrop’s demonstrated their values by devoting as much time and attention to their customers as their community, caring in and serving in a variety of ways, such as helping take groceries out and load them into the car. As the company footprint expanded, so did our family team, with Joe & Jacquelin’s sons Jim and Bob, joining the company and ensuring Ukrop’s fresh, high-quality products and commitment to customers were available to serve new communities throughout Virginia. Our growth wasn’t limited to new store locations. Ukrop’s expanded its product line through the purchase of Dot’s Pastry Shop, one of Richmond’s most loved bakeries, in 1976, and the opening of the Ukrop’s kitchen and bakery production facility in the early 1990s.
Ukrop’s kitchen and bakery production facility helped meet the growing demand for fresh and delicious prepared foods.
Many of Dot’s decades-old recipes are still being used today for famous Decorated Cakes, iconic Rainbow Cookies, and signature Chocolate Fudge Pies, to name just a few. Today, the company’s brands are recognized and trusted names throughout the food industry.

wp:postmeta.wp:meta_value: Our fresh food journey began nearly eighty years ago when Joe & Jacquelin Ukrop purchased a small grocery store in Richmond, Virginia.

We donate 10% of our pre-tax profit to support family-focused organizations and events in the communities we serve.

item.title: Our Food Team
item.dc:creator: tfuqua
item.content:encoded: Making fresh and delicious foods, our company has the opportunity to have a profound influence on the lives of those who work for our company, supply and/or make purchases from our company, and those who enjoy our food.

item.title: Robert Ukrop
item.dc:creator: tfuqua
item.content:encoded:
As President and Chief Executive Officer of Ukrop’s Homestyle Foods, Bobby Ukrop drives the company’s passion and enthusiasm for fresh, delicious food. He began his business career in high school as a courtesy clerk at Ukrop’s Super Markets, the grocery store chain his family founded.
A graduate of the University of Richmond and the Darden School at the University of Virginia, Bobby spent over 40 years helping grow the Ukrop’s retail business and continuing his family’s passion for food while serving as the President and Chief Executive Officer from 1998-2010.
Bobby is actively involved in the community including: a co-founder and immediate past president of the Richmond Sports Backers and president of the Greater Richmond Aquatics Partnership. He serves on the boards of Communities in Schools of Virginia, Greater Richmond Fit 4Kids Foundation, The Richmond First Tee; and is on the Advisory Boards of the Massey Cancer Center and the Salvation Army.

item.title: Thomas Pearce
item.dc:creator: tfuqua
item.content:encoded:
Ukrop’s Homestyle Foods Executive Chef Thomas Pearce has spent more than 25 years in the food industry. He trained at the Culinary Institute of America in Hyde Park, N.Y., then worked at a five-star French restaurant in Cincinnati, Ohio. He draws on his classic French training for all the recipes he develops for Ukrop’s. He’s also brought a focus on producing items by hand and using fresh vegetables and herbs during the height of their growing seasons.
“My kitchen and recipe development philosophies are deeply rooted in the classics,” he says. “I stay true to what I learned in culinary school,” he says.
Most recently, Chef Pearce developed the Ukrop’s Bakes collection that provides quick, delicious meals for families. He also oversees quality control in Ukrop’s central kitchen, ensuring Ukrop’s Homestyle Foods are consistently carefully prepared for delicious flavor.

item.title: Jim Goodman
item.dc:creator: tfuqua
item.content:encoded:
<div id="wrap"><section class="main"> <div class="content"> <div class="left">
Executive pastry chef Jim Goodman’s passion for pastries began when he was assigned the role of Baker in the Marines. Goodman’s relationship with Ukrop’s began even earlier when he worked as a courtesy clerk at the Staples Mill location while he was in high school. Once he was honorably discharged from the Marines, Goodman returned to work for Ukrop’s as a delivery driver for Dot’s Pastry Shop.
Goodman trained with master baker Bill Dvorak of Dot’s Pastry Shop and with certified Master Pastry Chef Otto Bernet and he’s currently a certified Executive Pastry Chef. He’s also Vice President of the Virginia Chef’s Association, chairman and organizer of the Annual Chocolate Festival and chairman of the Otto Bernet Memorial Scholarship Committee.
Goodman’s obviously got the stats to prove his expertise, but his passion for creating custom cakes is what makes him stand above the rest. He’s won gold and silver medals in national pastry arts competitions; made car-shaped cakes for NASCAR drivers including Mark Martin, Terry Labonte, Jonny Benson and Greg Sacks; decorated the inaugural cake and several birthday cakes for former Governor George Allen; and provided cakes for many other prestigious events. “I like to make things that are a challenge,” Goodman says. Some of the projects he’s tackled include icing cakes to replicate historic Richmond buildings, constructing a groom’s cake in the shape of a regulation-sized basketball and creating an exact replicate of the Jim Beam village in Kentucky from chocolate, sugar and gingerbread.
In his current role, he concentrates on research and development of new product as well as improvements to existing product lines for Ukrop’s Homestyle Foods.

item.title: Buntith Chhuon
item.dc:creator: tfuqua
item.content:encoded:
When Buntith Chhuon took a part-time high school job working for Chef Otto Bernet’s pastry shop, he had no idea it’d lead him down a cake-designing career path. He was working as an electrician when he decided he’d rather be in the kitchen. He got a culinary degree from Richmond Technical Center and eventually became a certified Pastry Chef. After working at The Jefferson, Chhuon came to work at Ukrop’s with Bernet in 1991.
His favorite part of making custom cakes is mastering new techniques. “I try to teach myself something every day - I love designing cakes.” Chhuon gets an adrenaline rush from the chance to create a unique cake, construct a new flower or tackle a fondant style he’s never tried before. Of the 1,000 different edible flowers Chhuon can create, some take several days to finish. “That’s why we need notice to bake a cake,” he says. “Sometimes I have to make one petal at a time and let each one dry separately.”

item.title: Julie Bishop
item.dc:creator: tfuqua
item.content:encoded: As the Director of Product Development and Quality for Ukrop’s Homestyle Foods, Julie works closely with our development chefs and combines her passion for great food with the science and technology behind it to ensure Ukrop’s Homestyle Foods meet exceptional quality standards. She holds a M.S. in Food Science and Technology from Virginia Tech and graduated Magna Cum Laude from Indiana University of Pennsylvania with a B.S. in Food and Nutrition Science and a minor in chemistry. Julie has been with Ukrop’s since 1993.

item.title: Mary Ruth Coleman
item.dc:creator: tfuqua
item.content:encoded:
A graduate of VCU in Richmond, VA with an undergraduate degree in Marketing, Mary Ruth brings more than 12 years of extensive work experience in the food industry to Ukrop’s Homestyle Foods. Mary Ruth’s career began during her childhood years growing up in a large family of 9 (Thanksgiving for 30 – now that’s a catering job!). Her passion for food and food service developed with Ukrop’s Super Markets as she wrote recipes for busy cooks, helped develop a line of gourmet private label items and sourced local products for a small market, all while running a private catering and wedding cake business on the side. Her catering and hospitality experience includes event planning and management for major corporate events, non-profit and private gatherings.
In addition to her work in food service, Mary Ruth has a wealth of research and project management experience. She is passionate about great customer service and enjoys nourishing families through her role as Catering Manager. Mary Ruth also serves on the Advisory Board of Needle’s Eye Ministries.

item.title: Welcome to Gather Around
item.dc:creator: user
item.content:encoded:
[caption id="attachment_353" align="aligncenter" width="450" caption="Ukrop's Signature Triple Cheese Macaroni and Cheese"][/caption]

Hello and welcome to Gather Around, the new Ukrop's Homestyle Foods blog. Here at Ukrop's we love great food and we know you do too. Gather Around is designed to help you understand how to enjoy our prepared foods and baked goods in new, delicious ways. Check in with us throughout the week for quick easy recipes featuring our food and new, creative ways to use our food to feed your family.

Please comment: tell us what you'd like to see, what recipes you've tried and feel free to ask questions about any of our recipes or products. We're here to help you. Thanks for reading and we'll see you back here soon!

wp:comment.wp:comment_content: UKROP'S backery is the best. You can't have a birthday party without their cake. My son and I crave for the Ukrop's birthday cake even when there isn't a birthday party. We find ourselves driving to Ukrop's just to purchase a slice of birthday cake. We appreciate Martin's for keeping Ukrop's bakery.

Ukrops' turkey tetrazzini is out of this world! It is a family favorite for dinner and now my friends' favorites as well. I live 25 minutes from any Martin's store and will gladly drive just to get my fix.
Delicious and as good, if not better, than you can make yourself.

In 2005 we moved to TN. One of the foods I really missed was Ukrops chicken and potato wedges. The other food was breakfast pizza that I use to get and take to work on cold and wet mornings. When we moved back to VA in 2007 the first thing I got after we parked the truck was Ukrops chicken. Boy was it great to be home. Back in the best state and back at Ukrops the best store around.
I always look forward to shopping, especially for the prepared foods. The cakes are delicious, the meatloaf is great and everything is at a good price. Everyone is willing to help.
I will immediately seize your rss feed as I can not in finding your e-mail subscription link or newsletter service. Do you have any? Please let me know in order that I could subscribe. Thanks.

item.title: Richmond Moms Love Ukrop's Homestyle Foods!
item.dc:creator: user
item.content:encoded:
by Kate Hall, RichmondMom.com

The day the Ukrop's sign came down from our favorite grocery store was a challenging one for my kiddos.

“Mama, where is Ukrop's goin’?” I had to really think about the answer. After all, Ukrop's was more than a grocery store to the kids. It’s where we ate lunch, picked out rainbow cookies (and stopped by the counter for our free sample), and picked up last-minute dinners when the days had gotten too crazy to cook for my family of five.

“It’s still the store we love, it’s just under a different name—Martin’s. And you know what’s cool? They still have all the yummy things you loved about Ukrop's!”

Their faces were questioning and skeptical.  “What about brownie bites and butterstar cookies?”

“Yep. They still have ‘em.”

“Cake?” my five-year-old-with-a-sweet-tooth asked with anticipation.

“You got it.”

“Cupcakes?” asked my eight-year-old.

“Umm-hmmm.” They were already sneaking bites from the open containers in the shopping cart. Choosing to pick my battles, I overlooked this.

As we loaded up the cart with our favorites we all felt a bit better about “losing” Ukrop's. Bite by bite, we realized that we still had all of our favorites.  Even this loyal Ukrop's shopper found myself thinking that change isn’t all that bad.

item.title: Ukrop's Homestyle Foods - Keeping a Richmond Tradition Alive
item.dc:creator: user
item.content:encoded:
by Kate Semp, RichmondMom.com

The recent transition of Ukrop’s stores to Martins has been a very emotional one for many Richmonders.  A quick search of Twitter, Google and Facebook and you will see many comments about what a large piece of the Richmond experience Ukrop’s is to the community.  Some that did grow up in Richmond did not understand that many were not losing a grocery store but a warm friendly location that carried the smells and treats of childhood and many special events.

I am not a local Richmonder but I am married to one.  Early on in my relationship I tried to win over my now husband and step-daughter by cooking for them.  Turns out I made a few key mistakes.  For my step-daughter a Sunday family dinner is incomplete without White House rolls.  Period.

And when I set out to put on the perfect birthday party for my loves I made the biggest mistake of all - I planned on making the cake!  My mother in-law to be was offended -mad even.  She always got the cake and it was always from Ukrop’s.

Little did I know at the time that a Ukrop’s cake IS a birthday in Richmond.  This became more evident as we began to attend birthday parties with our children and many parents say, "I always make sure I am here for the cake cutting.  I love Ukrop’s cake."  Which is always followed by the discussion - the cake or the icing - what is your favorite part and why?

Another childhood staple is the infamous Rainbow Cookies.  This crumbly cookie of goodness is part of a quiz, "How Richmond Are You" and even has it's own Facebook group (not Ukrop's sponsored).  This cookie triggers for many memories of shopping trips with their mothers and stopping by the bakery for their free cookie.  The rainbow cookie is Ukrop’s.

But my husband's all time favorite is the Chocolate Fudge Pie.  He would eat a whole pie in a sitting if my kids didn't make him share.  But at any moment I can find him standing over the pie fork in hand.  Often I grab the little individually wrapped pies at check-out.  A little token of love for my husband to let him know I was thinking about him.

Food is powerful.  Simple smells and tastes can invoke memories and emotions.  Moments shared with loved ones in the past can bring those feelings back to the present.  And Richmonders can breathe a sigh of relief that the foods they love are still available to share with friends and family and can create new memories.

wp:comment.wp:comment_content: It's hard to choose a favorite Ukrop's prepared food, but I'll have to go with the chocolate fudge pie. It's a holiday must-have for us.
Any of Ukrop's vanilla cupcakes and birthday cakes. The icing is like no other!
LEMON CHESS PIE IS MY FAVORITE

item.title: Tell Us Your Favorite Ukrop's Food and Win $100 in Free Groceries!
item.dc:creator: user
item.content:encoded:
[caption id="attachment_346" align="aligncenter" width="450" caption="Ukrop's Homestyle Foods CEO Bobby Ukrop's favorite sweet from Ukrop's is our Bar Cake. What's your favorite?"][/caption]

We know you all love Ukrop's Homestyle Foods. And, who wouldn't love a week of free groceries? We're giving you a chance to win it here at Gather Around! All you have to do is leave a comment on this post with your all-time favorite Ukrop's food between now and June 30 and you'll automatically be entered for a chance to win a $100 Martin's Gift Card! The winner will be notified via email and announced here on July 2. Good luck!

wp:comment.wp:comment_content: It has to be Duchess Potato Casserole. My sister loves them too. Whenever I go visit her in NC I always have to bring a couple of containers to her.

Hard to chose just one! and currently I am ONLY shopping Martins for Ukrops products. Martin's "feels" too hard-edged, definitely NOT the same customer service - no one taking groceries to the car any more that I could see;, having to show one's driver's license like a common thief; and terrible color choices with those dayglow green t-sheets and all those tacky green & yellow tags on the aisles. But I digress..... oh, my the croissants - the lightest, most buttery and fresh ever - I try to limit myself to one a day, but end up polishing them off before the sun sets on the first day - like to pull them apart and eat them gradually, like you do cotton candy. If one or two make it to the next day - then with Sunday Brunch omelet or scrambled eggs and sometimes stuffed with tarragon chicken salad for lunch [I've tried making that at home, but cannot duplicate the taste or freshness.] The roast chicken!! I get it hot and my cat and I consume the legs and wings for supper-meat just falls off the bone- NONE of the other stores seem able to duplicate the recipe or the quality. I feast on the breast for lunches taken to work during the week in salads and on Fridays pull the carcass apart and stir fry with veggies for dinner - 7 meals from one bird! Favorite sides include the sour cream potato salad, corn pudding, macaroni, baked stuffed potatoes, and seafood salad. I'm VERY grateful you staying in the food production business. Will be happy to hear where ever else your products can be purchased other than Martins.
My all time favorite is the Old Fashioned Meatloaf and the Coconut Pie! I've always loved both as a child and Ukrops' recipe is the closest thing to home cooking!!

Our family favorite has to be the chocolate cake with chocolate icing... Every time one of our five kids hits the 1/2 birthday mark, it's time to head out to pick up a 1/2 cake from the bakery section at Ukrops/Martin's. It's become a big tradition in our family, and one that the kids never let us forget about when it's someone's 1/2 birthday!! We all love the chocolatey goodness; both the cake and especially the icing. We are a from-scratch family, too; all other cakes and icings and cookies and goodies are always made from whole foods and from scratch. But once we found the Ukrop's 1/2 chocolate cakes, we took the plunge into that yummyness and have never looked back!
Ukrops fried chicken! Such an iconic favorite that if I were to ever start a band, I would name it "Ukrop's Chicken."
The Ukrop's Bakes White House Roll Bread Pudding - definitely the best way to eat the famous White House Rolls!

Oh too many favorites to pick just one! Vinegar BBQ, Chicken Cobbler, London Broil, and Old Fashioned Potato Salad from the Kitchen and Butterscotch Brownies, Ginger Treats, and Pumpkin Pie from the Bakery. They're making me hungry just thinking about them!
the cake. Any of the cakes. White icing...yes. Chocolate icing...yes. Strawberry icing..yes. I have not met a ukrops cake I didn't love!
The bread pudding is THE BEST!

Ukrop's (well, Martin's) just would not be the same without the classic Ukrops cakes. Anytime we have a birthday at home, or at work (or any other excuse to eat cake) there is never a question where to get our cakes. From the super moist cake to the best icing around - Ukrops cake is amazing!
Rainbow cookies, hands down.
The Cranberry Orange scones....hands down;)

Two of my all time favorites are the white chicken salad (sooooo yummy!) and the yellow cake with the chocolate icing - the yellow cupcakes with the chocolate icing are awesome too. OH! And the Chocolate pie ... so maybe I don't have only two favorites?? :-) I'm just very very VERY very grateful Martins and Ukrops worked it out so we can have Ukrops prepared foods still with the transition.

The White House Rolls- whenever we have them in the house my kids beg for a second roll with dinner INSTEAD OF DESSERT! I love the macaroni and cheese, chicken cobbler, and bread pudding...we love our carbs in my family :) Oh and the buttercream frosting tubs- we put the chocolate flavor on banana slices and eat them on graham crackers...delish!
My all time favorite foods are chicken salad and white house rolls. It makes any picnic complete!

Oh so many! The Triple Cheese Macaroni and Cheese is to die for. Oh such gooey cheesy goodness! And it's especially good when I don't have time to make homemade mac and cheese. The Tomato Basil Soup and the Homestyle Chicken Noodle soup are so good on a cold winter day. Oh, and the White House Rolls - yummy! The Lump Crab Cakes (either in the Seafood department or the ones you can reheat from the Kitchen area) are awesome! Much better than most restaurants. And how can you go wrong with just about anything in the Bakery. The icing alone is just heavenly, the pound cake birthday cakes is always my request : )
My all-time favorite since I was younger has to be the buttercream coffee cake. A close second is the chicken salad. MMM
the fried chicken are the BEST!

RAINBOW COOKIES!
My 2 yr old son learned "Please" & Thank you" by Ukrop's folks offering him a Rainbow Cookie everytime we pass the bakery.
"Thank you" Ukrop's for treating us like family and "please" keep all the great foods coming!

Rainbow cookies!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!! Yummy!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!! I am old enough to remember when Ukrops took over Dots Pastry and their tradition of giving away a cookie. Defintely rainbow cookies are my favorite!
Definitely the macaroni and cheese! It's so creamy and delicious.
Love, love, love the lemon poppy scones, ginger treats, and the triple mac-n-cheese!
My favorite would have to be the white house rolls. But I also loved the carrot cake and the pecan coffeecake ring.
White House Rolls-- I love them as a side with dinner or to make mini sandwiches. They are my downfall!
The twice baked potato's!!! With the cheese and bacon-so good and yummy! I love love love them!!

We moved from the Baltimore area 2 years ago we have found several UKrops treats that we have come to love and are so glad remained. One special treat, the chocolate covered Macaroons, are one that can only be found at Ukrops....in fact, when my Mother comes to visit I am sure to have them for her to enjoy while she is in town. Not sure if she is coming to visit because she has missed us or the chocolate covered macaroons :)
SOOOOOOOO many great choices....but my husband would say it's the chocolate cake with chocolate icing! What is a birthday in Richmond with a UKROPS cake???

I have always loved the birthday cakes. When we first moved to Richmond I could not believe the wonderful chocolate cakes with the fabulous fudgey icing --loved, loved, loved them! Now, many years (and cakes) later I crave the plain yellow cakes with white sugary icing. These cakes can not be beat!! It would not be a birthday - or Richmond - without them!

The cookies! Oh, my goodness! The best cookies ever are the little swirly colored cookies and the thumbprint cookies with the icing. They both are so hard to resist I just love them... and my family too!
Recently we had some of the swirly colored ones and of course they were disappearing quickly. So, my daughter who is home from college, claimed the last remaining ones and dared anyone else to eat them. How could she? Well, I couldn't resist, I had to sneak just one more!
My two absolute favorite foods are the chicken salad and the lemon pound cake!! Delicious!

I agree there are so many favorites of mine...but I would have to say that the Macaroni and Cheese is my all time favorite. If it is a dessert...the strawberry shortcake is divine! I am so glad that Ukrop's is staying on board in spite of the change! Love my comfort food....

OK, I'm not a native Richmonder so when I first moved here in 1999 and lived in the fan, I heard of Ukrops but didn't understand what the excitement was all about. People take your groceries out to the car? Great! But I'm guessing all of the groceries are so expensive that's how they pay for it. It wasn't until I attended a co-worker's wedding in Richmond in 2002 that I had my first "taste" of Ukrops ~ THE WEDDING CAKE. It was the best wedding cake I'd ever tasted (and I'd been to A LOT of weddings throughout the US). I thought for sure that she got it from some high-end boutique bakery. When she told me it was from Ukrops, I was shocked and amazed that a grocery store could produce such a scrumptious and beautiful wedding cake. So, when I got married in 2003 I knew exactly where I wanted my wedding cake made ~ Ukrops. It was everything I hoped it would be and everyone raved about it (majority of our guests were from out of town). Now, I'm thrilled to say that I live a 1/4 mile from the John Rolfe Martin's with the Ukrops Bakery and I love ALL of their cakes/goodies. Now, if they would just make them calorie free... ;)
Ukrop's yellow cake, white icing. Perfection.

What a hard choice! The birthday cakes alone make me swoon... I will have to go with the #1 choice for all 4 members of my family, from 1 - 44 years old, the macaroni and cheese. Ooey, gooey heaven for cheese lovers!!!

Oh by far and away the Chocolate PIE! My family has moved away from Richmond but if I visit and do not bring one...they would probably send me home. Of course I am also instructed to bring White House Rolls, Rainbow Cookies, and Chili too! :)
I love the Beet and Onion salad that is served on the salad bar. I have tried to replicate it at home but cannot. I also love the Duchess Potato Casserole. YUMMY!!!!!!!
The chocolate pie is to die for:)

Chocolate Fudge Pie!!!!!!!!!!! It is to die for!!!!! My family knows this is a MUST for my b-day!!!!!! LOL!!! I also find myself heading there bi-weekly *gasps* at least and the only thing I purchase on these trips is this pie!!!! If you've never tried it you MUST do so IMMEDIATELY!!! :D Enjoy!!!
My all time favorite is the half and half cake... Mmmmmm They have so many good things. I feel the same as others, just not the same going into Martin's.
I adore the White House Roll Bread Pudding and Duchess Potato Casserole - the combination got me through my first trimester nausea. They were the only thing I was interested in for weeks!
I LOVE Ukrop's Corn Pudding AND the Chicken Salad!!! YUM
Without a doubt....the mac and cheese! It just melts in your mouth! YUM!
Chocolate Chess Pie - definitely not the same when made by anyone else - close second would be Butterstar cookies which no one else has!

The Fried Chicken is the best! When I was pregnant with both my kids, I dreamt about the chicken and ate way too much of it. And trust me...you don't need to be pregnant to crave it. Thanks Ukrops for making life delicious.

It has got to be the bar cake (what I call the 7 layer cake). It tastes like Talheimer's seven layer cake. Whenever I eat this cake I think of of my childhood and being with my family and my great-grandmother. I cannot tell a difference between the Ukrop's cake and the cake of my childhood! My mother just served the cake at our family's Mother's Day celebration and it was best food there!
definitely the White House Rolls, probably as close as I'll ever get to having my Grandma's again. They're awesome!

There is nothing that Ukrops Home Style Cooking division puts out that I don't love, and I've tried just about everything...from their mac and cheese, prepared dinners for two, chicken, soups, desserts....the list goes on and on. If I have to say a favorate I would have to pick the breakfast pizza by far. Martins has done a good thing by keeping the Ukrops bakery and deli as it was. Thank you and I welcome Martins.
Joan Stromberg

I didn't shop at Ukrop's as much as I would have like to, but when I did get a chance to shop there I always shopped for my favorites like the sliced birthday cakes, three cheese mac &cheese in the hot foods section of course, bread pudding with that tasty sauce that is added on top, pizza slices, and the cucumber salad, the fresh salad bar, and their deviled crabs. Whenever the kids had their birthday or special events I would always order a Ukrop's cake, or variety of cupcakes for the occasion. When I heard that Ukrop's was closing and selling the business I said "Where will I go now for the best birthday cakes, best hot foods, and the best salad bar ever"? I shop at Martin's because they offer excellent prices that I could not afford before, and I can still shop for my Ukrop's favorites. Everything is in order now!

I love everything they put out, and I've tried almost everything. I do love their breakfast pizzas by far. Thank you Martins for keeping Ukrops Home Style Cooking division. Martins has done a good thing by keeping the Ukrops bakery and deli as it was. Thank you and I welcome Martins to the neighborhood.
Love everything but the breakfast pizza is by far my favorate. Thank you Martins for keeping the home style cooking division of Ukrops.

I am sorry, but I have too many favorites to pick just one. I do have to say that I agree with Bobby Ukrop on the bar cake. It is one of our family traditions that a birthday is incomplete without this cake. My family's favorite dinner is the fried chicken and potato wedges, but don't forget the white house rolls because my 7 year old daughter will send you back to the store to buy them! Both of my children (I'm lying, my husband and I too!) love the rainbow cookies. Starburst cookies were my childhood favorite when visiting my great grandparents. And last but definitely not least the cheese bread (which they apparently have stopped selling).
Ukrop's, we miss you!!

I'v grown up here living in Bon Air then moving on my own into chesterfield. Ukrops has always been there, all the food they fix is good but I'd have to say the Shepards Pie is best on those cold Richmond nights. Martins is ok but it's not Ukrops, thank goodness ukrops is still doing the cooking or I wouldn't be shopping there.

White house rolls and chicken salad. Are the top two - everytime my daughter is home from Overseas these are one of the first things she wants to have, followed by the macaroni & cheese and then the brownie bites.

I agree with previous posts - it's hard to pick just one. I could choose the cop-out answer and say "Dinner for Two", 'cause that includes everything! I think I'd have to say the Mediterranean Pasta Salad. I love the olives and would never put them in a salad for myself, but they are YUUUUUMY!

It would have to be the buffalo chicken dip. When my family comes from California we end up having to freeze at least 4 of them, to take back to CA. Perfect party appetizer with tortilla chips. We only buy it when we have company, otherwise we'd eat the entire thing ourselves!
I love the pumpkin and apple pies. They are always convenient around the holidays and they tasted just as good as homemade (at least my version of homemade:).
I LOVE their Mediterranean Salad. I could eat it all day, it's that yummy!
Chicken Cobbler--While my girls were growing up this is all they would want to eat for dinner. They absolutely love it!!

The Chicken Salad is my favorite! My husband doesn't even like Chicken Salad but there is something about Ukrop's Chicken Salad that he loves. It is the staple for any cookout, birthday party, baby shower, etc. at our house!
Chocolate pie I COULD EAT 100 in a row and never get sick! Seriously!

My favorite Ukrops Homestyle food has to be the chocolate pie. It's like Pringles, once you pop you can't stop. If I buy one it's all I think about all day!! I really am glad that Martin's kept the Ukrop's Bakery and Cafe products. I don't know how I would deal without my pie!!
There are too many "favorites" to choose just one! We love the fried chicken, cole slaw, chicken salad, rainbow cookies, butter stars.....
Ukrop's Fried Chicken (accompanied with White House Rolls and Potato wedges)! Nothing better for a family picnic!
My favorite Ukrop's food is the macaroni and cheese, but I love White House rolls and the brownie bites too!
Like several people have said, there are too many favorites to just pick one. I'd say fried chicken, White House Rolls, and BBQ ribs.
Fried chicken and of course, the rainbow cookies

Hands Down...it's the chocolate pie! My grandmother use to make chocolate pies for me and my cousin when I was a child. The only one I've ever found that equals hers is Ukrops! Even when my father has used my grandmother's receipe to make me a pie!!! For me, there is no such thing as a birthday cake...my is a birthday pie!
Ukrops white chicken salad!
My favorite, is the chicken. It allows my son and I to have a few extra minutes to talk and spend the evening together. No cooking needed, the best cooks have already prepared it for us.

My favorite Ukrop's Kitchen food has got to be the layered strawberry gelatin dessert. I love the texture and taste of the berry Jell-O with pieces of real fruit in it, followed by smooth cream cheese layers...sinfully good, yet not too bad for you as far as desserts are concerned!

What to choose, what to choose...the White House rolls, ALL of the DELICIOUS bakery items...especially their cakes with the oh so yummy icing!! I could eat the icing alone!! The already prepared items are so helpful for a working mom on the go like the macaroni and cheese and the stuffed baked pototoes! Thanks Martins for keeping many of the traditional and family loved food items made special by Ukrops!
Mmmmm macaroni and cheese, chocolate pie, sour cream potato salad...guess that's more than one!
Hands down, Ukrop's birthday cake! No birthday is complete without one. And hopefully, whoever does the ordering accounts for having leftovers since it is also a fabulous breakfast food.
The Baked Spaghetti, or maybe it's the mac and cheese, or the old fashioned meatloaf. there are too many to count.
Lemon Chess Pie
My favorite? Hmmm... just one? i'll go with the Chocolate iced doughnut, it is not just a doughnut with chocolate on top, it is a GLAZED doughnut with Ukrops icing on top!
Crab Quiche!!!! Need I say more? It's not always available, bummer. But when it is, I always get at least one. Thanks for continuing to service us with your delicious food. We miss you!

My 3 year old son loves the macaroni and cheese! He will not eat macaroni anywhere else! We also love the fried chicken, rolls, and potato wedges! My husband is addicted to your mini pecan pies. So glad to see that Martin's still carries all of our Ukrop's favorites.
Where's the Ukrop's cake. You can't have a party without it. We love Ukrop's bakery. Thanks Martin for keeping Ukrop's bakery.
I love your Whitehouse Rolls!!! They are the best! Every party I host includes them. So thankfully that you are continuing to make your delicious food!!
The strawberry creme salad and all of their potato salads are awesome! We also can't resist their cakes!!
My favorite is the chicken salad--a go-to for any luncheon. My husband's is the mashed potatoes--a staple at every holiday meal. Also love their potato salad (all of them).

As much as I hate to admit (because the calories alone could be 2 meals!), it's the baked potatoes! All of that diced, sour cream, cheese, bacon and chive goodness! It can't be beat! And then there is the Tarragon Chicken Salad....PERFECT for picnics and a mid afternoon small snack nosh!
Too many to list! My ultimate favorite is the chicken salad!! It is to die for! Next would have to be their frosting-I can eat it plain!
[...] like waxing eloquent about your favorite Ukrop’s Homestyle Food? Post it on Gather Around by June 30 and be entered to win a $100 MARTIN’S gift [...]
Hot cross buns at easter! You really can't find them anywhere else!
My absolute favorite is the Chicken Salad on a white house roll! You can't beat it!
White House Rolls and Fried Chicken! Yum!!!
The strawberry cake!!! It is just perfect!! My only complaint about it: is not available all year! : )
Rainbow cookies - they remind me of being a kid.
The Ukrop's white house rolls are definitely a favorite of mine!
I always loved the cheese bread, but I don't think you make it anymore becasue I can't find it in any Martin's stores. Rainbow cookies top the list now!
White house rolls with Ukrops Chix salad!
It's hard to pick just one, but my 2 year-old daughter and I love the triple cheese mac-n-cheese. for dessert, chocolate pie is one of our families' favorites!
I love Ukrop's fried chicken and pecan pie!
A meal of fried chicken, potato wedges, and mac and cheese from Ukrops CANNOT be beat!
I love Ukrops fried chicken and pecan pie!

I love the lite tuna salad from the salad bar. No matter how I make it at home, it never comes out tasting like the Ukrop's tuna salad. It is such a simple thing, but soo good. Pair the lite tuna salad with some wheat White House rolls and I am in heaven. Lunch is served!!
Impossible to pick one. Close to the top of my list would be your lasagna.

I loved the Joe's Market Tavern Mustard Potato Chips--they were delicious!-- and haven't been able to find anything like them that's nearly as good. Will Ukrop's ever make these again and possibly market under another name for sale in the Martin's Stores (or anywhere else)?
I love the chicken salad and cole slaw. It is the only cole slaw I will eat anymore!!!
SO MANY CHOICES- SO LITTLE TIME- WE LOVE RHE DUCHESS MASHED POTATOES! IT CAN'T BE A HOLIDAY DINNER WITHOUT THEM!

We love the light Chicken salad and the Rainbow cookies and of course, the birthday cakes with buttercreme icing. My husband will stop in just to get a cake and write on it "Happy Day" even when nobody's birthday exists!

I LOVE the chicken salad!!!
MaggieB http://www.cookbookclub101.com/
I love the rainbow cookies (evoke childhood memories) and the pearl cous cous salad and the Irish soda bread for St. Patrick's Day!

I agree with everyone else that to pick just ONE favourite item from the Ukrops Kitchen is very difficult. We just love the Baked Manicotti. And the Mandarin Orange Jello Salad is a family favourite even for those that aren't local. Then there's the Brocoli slaw, and well, the Charleston Shrimp Spread (which I don't think I have seen since the transition :-(). See, too hard to pick just one!

My fav is the chicken caeser pasta. But on behalf of my mom who moved out of state - your chocolate pie. She as a standing order with us in Richmond to bring one (or two, or three) when we come visit! Usually bring 2 - one to enjoy during the visit, and one just for her after we leave!

I would have to say if I have to pick one favorite, and that's a really hard thing to do, I would have to pick the Ukrop's Kitchen's Crab Cakes! Several Mother's Days when having our Mom's over for lunch we served those wonderful Crab Cakes and every year we are asked if we are having them. We love them too and we have to say they are gourmet restaurant quality!
My other half really loves the Lemon Chess Pies too! And what would a special meal be without your famous White House Rolls.
Joe
In our family, it's the chocolate bar cake. The icing is wonderful and the cake is moist. YUMMY!
I love the chocolate bar cake, there are other things too but this one I love the most!
My family and I love your rainbow cookies. We could probably eat a whole container in a sitting if that were allowed. :)
Those wonderful little two-bite lemon poppy seed scones are our favorite!
I might be 49 years of age, but I just can’t seem to get enough of the shortbread cookies shaped like leprechauns, Santa Claus, Uncle Sam, and Pilgrims. They make me feel like a kid again!
I love the star cookies and birthday cakes made of pound cake. I'm very happy they are still available.

It makes me so happy to still be able to get some of my all-time favorites, such as the fried chicken, White House rolls, Bar Cake and of course Rainbow Cookies. It has made the transition to Martins much easier, knowing that these items and many others will still be available. Thank you!
I like a lot of things but the chocolate fudge pie is my personal favorite.
panini... chicken salad... panini....chicken salad... panini... chicken salad... panini!
The chicken salad is to die for....and it MUST go on a Dot's roll, uh, a whitehouse roll.

The Chocolate Pie is my very favorite. But if you want a "meal" dish then I would choose the Chicken Cobbler. But then I always love the chicken salad and the quiches. It's all good, and I'm so glad that you're continuing to provide your good foods.
I love the Ukrops White House Rolls.
There are lots, but my favorite is the Chocolate Layer Bar cake. I don't usually like to buy cakes, but this one is awesome. I could eat the entire cake myself.
Love the White House Rolls - they are definitely my favorite!
Definitely Chicken Salad. Followed closely by white house rolls and anything from the bakery!!
I'd have to say the mashed potates are the best. They are sooooooooooo creamy!
Chicken salad... I take it to my son when I am visiting him in Maryland because he loves it so much.

My familiy's favorite food are the Ukrops rainbow cookies! We get them every month as a treat. Beside being delicious we also like how the colors change for the season or current event. (they changed the colors for the premier of the new baseball team The Flying Squirrels.) A trip to Ukrops was always special for the kids because they got a special treat at the bakery if they were good!
Bar cake, bar none.
Ukrops Strawberry Shortcake. I kid you not. It tastes like cotton candy!! And the calorie count is low for a cake :)

item.title: Our Recipe for 4th of July Perfection
item.dc:creator: user
item.content:encoded:
by Kate Hall, RichmondMom.com

INGREDIENTS 

2 dozen Ukrop’s White House Rolls

A big 'ol heaping pile of Smithfield Ham

Ukrop’s Potato Salad

Ukrop’s Macaroni Salad

Mama's Fruit Salad, cubed watermelon, cantaloupe, and blueberries served in the watermelon half

Ukrop’s Rainbow Cookies

Ukrop’s Cupcakes, with red-white-and-blue sprinkles

Iced tea with lemon (and plenty of it)

Add:

3 crazy kids, starving from swimming

1 hungry hubby, who wants his own container of Rainbow Cookies all to himself

Serve with:

Friends and family, preferably on a red-and-white checkered tablecloth

Sprinkle:

A dash of laughter, hugs, and playfulness

Mix in:

A nap (if you're lucky)

Finish with:

The whole family under the night sky, fireworks blazing

Repeat:

Year after year. Enjoy.

Macaroni is a variety of dry pasta made with durum wheat. Elbow macaroni noodles normally do not contain eggs, (although they may be an optional ingredient) and are normally cut in short, hollow shapes; however, the term refers not to the shape of the pasta, but to the kind of dough from which the noodle is made. Although home machines exist that can make macaroni shapes, macaroni is usually made commercially by large-scale extrusion.:.-,

item.title: Pimento Cheese Three Ways
item.dc:creator: user
item.content:encoded:
[caption id="attachment_392" align="aligncenter" width="450" caption="Guests will gobble up these cheesy, spicy sliders."][/caption]

Ukrop’s Cheddar Pimento Cheese is a tasty take on a Southern favorite. While most pimento cheese spreads are made with processed American cheese, the chefs at Ukrop’s use medium-sharp Tillamook Cheddar for a product that’s packed with fresh, cheesy flavor. Look for regular Ukrop’s Cheddar Pimento Cheese and Ukrop’s Cheddar and Jalapeno Pimento Cheese in 10-oz. containers at Martin's.

Pimento Cheese lends itself perfectly to summer cookouts. That cheesy, gooey flavor is perfect for chowing down on a warm afternoon. We cooked up our Spicy, Cheesy Sliders featuring Ukrop’s Cheddar Pimento Cheese that can be enjoyed all summer long.


Spicy, Cheesy Sliders
Serves: 8 as an appetizer  | Prep Time: 8 minutes | Cook Time: 10 minutes

1 pound All-Natural Angus Ground Chuck (80/20)
3 Tbsps. A1 Bold & Spicy Steak Sauce (less for less heat)
½ teaspoon salt
½ teaspoon pepper
1 tub Ukrop’s Cheddar Pimento Cheese
8 Ukrop’s Bakery Artisan Bread Rolls, cut in half
Bread and butter pickle slices

Preheat grill to medium hot. Place meat in a bowl. Sprinkle with A1, salt and pepper and stir until sauce is evenly distributed. Divide mixture into 8 2-ounce tightly packed patties. Place sliders on grill and cook for 4 to 5 minutes or until they are crusty on one side, then flip and cook for an additional 4 minutes. Remove from grill. Place 1 patty on each Artisan roll then top with 1 heaping tablespoon Cheddar Pimento Cheese.

item.title: Get out the Grill - Ukrop’s Executive Chef Tom Pearce’s Shrimp with Rémoulade Sauce
item.dc:creator: user
item.content:encoded:
Ukrop's. Homestyle Foods Executive Chef Tom Pearce often makes this spicy grilled appetizer at cookouts and other events. “Friends make me make it over and over,” he says of the New Orleans-inspired dish. Although it takes lots of ingredients, the process is pretty simple. Give it a try and wow your friends with your culinary prowess.

If you’re having friends over this weekend, give this recipe a try.

Ukrop’s Executive Chef Tom Pearce’s Shrimp with Rémoulade Sauce
Prep Time: 35 minutes | Cook Time: 5 minutes |Serves: 12 as an appetizer

Spicy Rémoulade Ingredients:
1/2 cup mayonnaise
1/2 teaspoon garlic, finely chopped
1 tablespoon prepared horseradish
1 tablespoon ketchup
1 teaspoon fresh lemon juice
1/2 teaspoon Worcestershire sauce
Tabasco sauce, to taste
1 teaspoon Dijon-style mustard
1 tablespoon green onions, thinly sliced
1 tablespoon fresh parsley, chopped
1/2 teaspoon salt
1 tablespoon capers, drained

Shrimp Spice Mix Ingredients:
1 tablespoon chili powder
1 teaspoon ground cumin
1 teaspoon sugar
1 teaspoon salt
1/2 teaspoon black pepper
1/2 teaspoon dried thyme
1/4 teaspoon granulated garlic
1/4-1/2 teaspoon Tabasco sauce, depending on desired heat
3 tablespoons olive oil

2 lbs. (21/25 per pound) raw shrimp, peeled and de-veined, tail on

To prepare rémoulade sauce, combine all ingredients and mix well. Cover and refrigerate. Combine all spice mix ingredients in a large bowl. Add shrimp and toss evenly to coat. Cover and refrigerate 20-30 minutes. Heat a grill pan (or outdoor grill or heavy skillet) to medium-high heat. Grill shrimp until just barely opaque in the center (30-40 seconds) on each side.  Be careful not to overcook. Arrange on plates or a platter and serve with rémoulade sauce or refrigerate and serve chilled. Chef Pearce prefers serving this dish chilled or at room temperature.

Make this a meal by pairing shrimp with some of your favorite pasta salads from Ukrop's Kitchen!

item.title: Back to School with Ukrop's
item.dc:creator: user
item.content:encoded:
by Kate Hall, RichmondMom.com

There are just a few more calendar days to check off until the bus rolls to a stop at the end of our street. This year, we have not one but two lunches to pack for the very first time.

This is an exciting—and a bit sad—time for me as I watch my two little guys get a thrill over their shiny new pencil boxes and folders in their monogrammed backpacks.

To get them involved, we asked what they’d like to be in their lunches. One of their few healthy requests? Ukrop's Whitehouse rolls. How about some lunchmeat? Apples? Oranges? “Nah, mom. Just the rolls.”

Luckily for them I don’t always follow their requests to the letter! We’ll make sure there’s plenty of healthy goodies for them as they crack open their lunchboxes, and of course Ukrop's Homestyle Foods is always a part of that experience.

Here’s to new adventures—and old comforts—ahead.

item.title: Back to School Not Back to Boring
item.dc:creator: user
item.content:encoded:
Richmondmom, Kate Semp


[caption id="attachment_431" align="alignleft" width="300" caption="A variety of lunch options for Ukrop’s Homestyle Foods"][/caption]


It's back to school time! Pull out your trusty backpack, fill it with your new school supplies, grab your lunch and start a new year.  But for me, the lunch packing gets old pretty quick and I’ve got the lunch box blahs! To combat the blahs this year I have decided my kids need to pack their own lunch.  To make sure this endeavor is successful I need to help provide balanced nutritious items for them to pack

Taking a page from our summer picnics I looked at the variety of offerings from Ukrop’s Homestyle Foods to help maximize my options and save me a little time.

Ukrop’s Homestyle Foods offers a large selection of precut fruits and vegetables that help make packing a snap.

White House rolls are a staple.  This is the perfect do it yourself lunch item for kids.  They can pack 1, 2, or 3 little rolls and make a sandwich to order.  My kids don’t like their stuff to get soggy so we precut the rolls and then load all the fillings in a separate container.

I'm not against a sweet treat and the perfect dessert is Ukrop's mini cookies.  There are the staples, rainbow, chocolate chip and butter star, but my kids love the chewy ginger cookies! The kids feel are excited to have a treat and I can easily portion control.

And all of these precut treats and perfect portions make it easy for the kids to help themselves to a healthy afternoon snack.

[gallery link="file"]

Check out local Richmondmom, Cindy Bennett and her shop Monkey Grass Green, for options for waste free green lunch solutions.

item.title: Dinnertime Rush
item.dc:creator: user
item.content:encoded:
by Richmondmom, Kate Semp

The first week back to school came and went in a whirlwind.  The lazy days of summer were quickly replaced with the fast and furious days of fall.

But no matter how busy I am it is still incredibly important to me that my family eats healthy, well-balanced meals; even if I don’t have time to cook.   This time of year it’s great to turn to Ukrop’s Family-Sized Entrees, like Manicotti, Spaghetti or Chicken Cobbler, which are ready in 30 minutes.  Toss one in the oven, have the kids help set the table and make the salad, and dinner is ready!

What I also love about Ukrop’s Homestyle Foods is that I can order them online at Martin’s (www.richmond.martinsfoods.com) in advance.   It’s great knowing I can place an order for dinner for those days I know I am going to be super busy or as the days get shorter and I have to fit the same amount into fewer hours of light.

Whether you make your own or pick an entree up (we love a Rotisserie Chicken for a quick meal) there is also a great selection of Ready-to-Heat sides to complete any meal.

item.title: Savoring Summer
item.dc:creator: user
item.content:encoded:
by Kate Semp, Richmondmom.com contributor and mom of 5

One of my favorite aspects of summer is a spontaneous day trip with my kids like a quick trip to Yorktown Beach.  It’s a low cost mini-vacation and to help keep costs down I fill a cooler full of our picnic favorites.  With the help of Ukrop’s Homestyle Foods I don’t have to worry about planning because I know I can get delicious picnic perfect food anytime!

My picnic menu from Ukrop’s Homestyle Foods.

A picnic must is Ukrop’s White House Rolls.  These rolls are perfect for each kid to make their own sandwich or to munch on plain.

I like the Ukrop’s Tarragon Chicken Salad (perfect on the White House Rolls) and the Chicken Caesar Pasta Salad.  My kids love a side of Ukrop’s Macaroni Salad.

Of course you can’t have a picnic without Ukrop’s Fried Chicken or Chicken Tenders.  How can you resist?

Ukrop’s Homestyle Foods also has a great selection of fresh cut fruit and vegetables perfect for all day snacking.

And a perfect summer sweet treat that holds up to the heat is the Ukrop’s Butterstar Cookies.  The only place these cookies melt is in your mouth!

Ukrop’s Homestyle Foods has so many options of salads and desserts that everyone can get just what they want.  Make sure you check the Martin’s weekly sales flyer for great deals on your favorite Ukrop’s Homestyle Foods!

Do you have some availability in your calendar but no time to plan?  Go on-line to Martin’s and order your Ukrop’s Homestyle Foods for pick up at the store of your choice!

item.title: A Fresh Start
item.dc:creator: user
item.content:encoded:
by Richmondmom, Kate Semp

I feel as if I have been living under a rock.  Last week as I popped into Martin's I discovered an incredible assortment of fresh baked breakfast goodies from Ukrop's Homestyle Foods!  There are mini muffins, croissants, bagels, pastries, scones and donut holes.  And many of of these items have seasonal flavors.  I was excited to see a sign for Apple Cider Donut Holes but they were already sold out so I grabbed some Pumpkin Donut Holes instead!

As with many things during the school year I find my family gets stuck doing the same thing for breakfast most days.  I'm excited to brighten an overcast morning or end the school week with a new treat from Ukrop's Bakery!

[gallery link="file"]

item.title: October is Breast Cancer Awareness Month
item.dc:creator: user
item.content:encoded:
Ukrop's always has seasonal items out but did you know they also made items to help raise awareness for a cause.  October is Breast Cancer Awareness Month and you can find a variety of Ukrop's Homestyle Foods items in the stores helping raise awareness.

[gallery link="file" columns="2"]

item.title: Terrifyingly Tasty Treats
item.dc:creator: user
item.content:encoded:
My kids always ask to decorate cookies and cupcakes to create seasonal treats.  There is only one little catch to this fun idea.  I don't like to bake.  The other day I found these incredibly cute Halloween stencils for cupcakes that I, the I-don't-like-to-bake girl, had to have!  So I popped into Martin's and grabbed some Ukrop's Homestyle Foods cupcakes buttercream icing.  Grab a few fun decorations and after the kids have decorated and licked things clean there is not much mess left for mom!

[gallery link="file"]

item.title: Last Minute Halloween Happenings
item.dc:creator: user
item.content:encoded:
by Richmondmom Kate Semp

I am always amazed how busy Fall is with sports, activities and fun festive events.  Even with a full calendar we always end up squeezing in "one more thing."  Whether you have a Halloween party planned or just gathering a few friends Ukrop's Homestyle Foods has some great grab me treats to celebrate Halloween.


[gallery link="file" columns="2"]

item.title: Delicious Dinner in the Dark
item.dc:creator: user
item.content:encoded:
by Kate Hall, Richmondmom.com

The nights are getting colder and with Daylight Savings Time in full effect, the darkness descends more quickly. For most busy moms like myself, the nights seem shorter and making a healthy hot dinner can be a challenge.


Especially the nights when I’m shuffling two to gymnastics and dance class with just two hours in-between before the oldest goes to Cub Scouts. . .there’s so little time to prepare anything AND get homework done! That’s why we love Ukrop's Homestyle Foods Bakes & Prepared Sides.

There’s no need to talk my kids into cleaning their plates. . they love a Meatloaf Bake and some Ukrop's Mac and Cheese after a long day at school and  it gives them just enough energy to make it through until morning, when we get up and start our crazy lunch-packing morning routine. Keeping fruits and veggies already cut and prepared is helpful, too--it ensures a little variety in our meals and saves this mama time. Now if we could just pick up a clone when we were in the supermarket. . .

item.title: Petit Fours
item.dc:creator: user
item.content:encoded: Our famous poundcake filled with chocolate, hand-dipped in white chocolate and festively decorated with our signature buttercream, petit fours are a special holiday treat!

item.title: Fall Back on Ukrop's Homestyle Foods
item.dc:creator: user
item.content:encoded:
by Kate Semp, Richmondmom.com

I love to cook and can often be found Sunday afternoons prepping meals for the coming week.  Yet, with the arrival of Fall Ball, dance rehearsals, apple picking, pumpkin picking and a husband often out of town I have not had the time I want to prepare a home cooked meal.

Whether it’s a crazy day running the kids to their various activities or simply taking the time to sit down together for a slow Sunday supper I love having the option of Ukrop’s Homestyle Foods Bakes.  These family-sized entrees and sides can be hot and ready for a family dinner in just 30 minutes.  For my pasta-fiend children there is always debate about a warm and filling Baked Manicotti, Baked Spaghetti or Authentic Italian Lasagna Bake for the perfect meal after a long day.  Or on those days I want something like my grandmother used to make there is comforting Chicken Cobbler, mounds of Cheddar Mashed Potatoes and Meatloaf or Triple Cheese Macaroni and Cheese.

This last time we popped in they saw Buffalo Chicken Dip so they had to grab one of those too “just to try”.  And of course as we head to the check-out line they make a last minute grab for the some White House Rolls.

item.title: Win a holiday meal on us!

item.content:encoded: We've enjoyed spending the holidays at your table for more than twenty years. The holidays are a great time for sharing both food and memories. We'd love to hear from you. Share your memories of Ukrop's and the holidays in the comments section below. On Monday, December 6th, we will select one of the memories shared and provide the author with a FREE Ukrop's Holiday Meal compliments of Ukrop's Homestyle Foods. Share your holiday memory today and you and your family might be dining on us for Christmas!

item.title: Ukrop's Holiday Memory by Richmondmom.com Kate Hall
item.dc:creator: user
item.content:encoded:
by Kate Willoughby Hall, Richmondmom

When I first moved to Virginia from Pennsylvania years ago, my brother-in-law (30+ year Ukrop’s, associate now with MARTIN’s) kept going on and on about Ukrop’s White House Rolls and cakes, and how they have both been on the Christmas buffet for years.

I thought, "Really? What's the big deal?"

I soon found out. We devoured two packages of soft, flaky White House Rolls with our meal, longing for more (but always reminded by mom not to spoil our meal by filling up on bread.) When the Santa cake hit the table it topped off our meal perfectly, and I knew what I had been missing out on all those years. It's pretty neat that Ukrop’s has been a part of our family almost as long as I've been alive, and now Ukrop’s Homestyle Foods are on my childrens' plates (lucky little devils!)

What’s even neater--now the well-loved, hometown White House Roll Clusters are available in 125 Giant and Martin’s stores in Pennsylvania! So there are lots of lucky little devils in Richmond and beyond who will savor them this holiday season.

item.title: Ukrop's Holiday Memory - The Semp Family
item.dc:creator: user
item.content:encoded:
by Mike and Kate Semp

Christmas Eve was full of tradition for Mike's family and we share in many of them with our kids now.  There was always a fire in the fireplace and they popped popcorn with an old corn-popper over the fire.  His dad always read the original Night Before Christmas (no Rudolph!).  And the only cookies they ever put out for Santa were Ukrop's red and green Rainbow Cookies.  Because you know if Ukrop's cookies are your favorite they have to be Santa's too!

Share your favorite memories of Ukrop’s and the holidays for a chance to win a FREE Ukrop's Holiday Meal!

item.title: Winner of Ukrop's Homestyle Foods Christmas Holiday Meal
item.dc:creator: user
item.content:encoded:
Congratulations to Sharon S. who is the winner of the Ukrop’s Homestyle Foods Christmas Holiday Meal.  It was Sharon’s story that was selected by associates during our recent holiday luncheon.   We enjoyed reading each of the memories aloud after our meal.  Making the decision was difficult as there were many heart-felt entries.

Thank you very much for participating and for supporting Ukrop’s Homestyle Foods with your business.   All of us here wish you a very Merry Christmas and a healthy and prosperous New Year!

item.title: The Ultimate Groom’s Cake from Ukrop's Bakery
item.dc:creator: user
item.content:encoded:
by Kate Hall, Richmondmom.com

All brides seem to be including something on the reception menu these days that wasn’t always seen: The groom’s cake.  But actually this tradition isn’t new at all—it dates back to the 17th century!

[caption id="attachment_620" align="alignleft" width="300" caption="Ukrop's Homestyle Foods bakes up thousands of cakes each year for lucky Richmond brides and grooms, like the groom’s cake shown above."][/caption]

Historically it has been a rich dark fruit cake or was made to match the traditional “bride’s” or was even made to be the very top layer of the bridal cake, “drenched in brandy to preserve it for the celebration of the couple’s first wedding anniversary.” Neat!

Source: http://jankishlapetitefleur.com/v2/cakes_groomsstory.htm

item.title: Super Bowl 2011 Party Ideas with Richmond Families
item.dc:creator: user
item.content:encoded: by Kate Willoughby Hall, Richmondmom.com We’re excited to celebrate with friends and watch Super Bowl XLV, and to get the kids in the spirit and prepare for our guests we had some fun preparing yummy snacks with Ukrop's Homestyle Foods found at Martin’s stores. We’re sharing them here with you so you can create your own fun memories; please share your ideas with us, too! [caption id="attachment_665" align="alignleft" width="225"] Fun with Ukrop's Homestyle Foods cornbread[/caption] Ukrop's Homestyle Foods Cornbread and Gingerbread shapes: All that’s needed is a cutting board, fun cookie-cutter shapes and some delicious cornbread and/or gingerbread—we tried both. Kids choose their shapes—from footballs to a bunny rabbit—and cut out their own snacks. Voila! [caption id="attachment_672" align="alignright" width="300"] Cutting shapes with kids is easy with Ukrop's Gingerbread and Cornbread[/caption] Ukrop's Homestyle Foods White House Roll individual sandwiches: to make the easiest and yummiest snacks ever, we let the kids choose what they wanted on their rolls. My little kid chose grape jelly, her big brother peanut butter, and our big boy chose cheese slices which we melted by slipping the sandwich onto a baking sheet under the broiler. They loved making their own choices! [caption id="attachment_666" align="alignleft" width="225"] White House Rolls with kids' favorites[/caption] Ukrop's Frosted Cupcake decorating: We took the Richmond-famous cupcakes (now known around the country!), undecorated, and made our own little masterpieces. Team colors would be a fun addition, although we chose valentine and pink as our little princess typically gets her own way in this arena. [caption id="attachment_671" width="300"] Each cupcake is a child's work of art, starting with a vanilla Ukrop's Homestyle Foods cupcake[/caption] For decorations, kids can make their own paper football chains and even have a toss game where they “win” small prizes for having the longest throw outside before the big game—have fun with it!

item.title: Fan Favorites
item.dc:creator: user
item.content:encoded:
by Kate Semp

What is synonymous with football and cold weather?  Chili of course!  Ukrop’s Homestyle Foods serves up fan favorites to fuel any football frenzy.


Ukrop’s Homestyle Foods offers chili pre-packed ready to grab or available at the Richmond Martin’s soup station warm and ready to eat, and a variety of sizes to make sure you get enough.  Ukrop's Homestyle Foods also makes a Vegetarian Chili that is aslo gluten-free.

In my opinion nothing goes better with chili than cornbread and Ukrop's Homestyle Foods offers Sweet Cornbread and Jalapeno Cornbread.  My kids were fighting over the LAST BITE!

And since no Ukrop’s Homestyle Foods meal is complete without White House Rolls my kids wiped their bowls clean with their rolls.

Everyone has a way they love their chili and my football fans are no different.  We lay out a variety of toppings (banana pepper slices, jalapeno slices, shredded cheese, sour cream, an assortment of hot sauces, etc.) so each person can have their chili just the way they like it!

[gallery link="file" columns="2"]

item.title: Valentine's Day Treat for Your Sweet
item.dc:creator: user
item.content:encoded:
by Kate Semp, Richmondmom.com

My husband loves cupcakes.  He's always loved cupcakes.  Lately I've seen "gourmet" cupcakes popping up all over the city with some interesting flavors.  We've tried them all.  So when somebody asked him which ones he liked best, he thought about it for a few minutes and then the answer was clear:  Ukrop's Homestyle Foods cupcakes.  He's been enjoying their cupcakes for as long as he can remember and they're still his favorite.  Couple that with their wonderful Valentine's Day decorations and I have the perfect treat for my Valentine!

Ukrop's Homestyle Foods holiday decorated cupcakes also make a festive and delicious treat to bring to any party or event you may be attending to celebrate Valetine's Day.

[caption id="attachment_683" align="alignleft" width="300" caption="Chocolate Cake with Chocolate Icing"][/caption] [caption id="attachment_682" align="aligncenter" width="300" caption="Chocolate Cake with White Icing"][/caption]

item.title: Ukrop's Cakes are a Celebration
item.dc:creator: user
item.content:encoded:
by Richmond mom Kate Hall

To many people, a cake is just another sweet treat expected at a birthday party. For many Richmonders though, it’s not really a cake, unless it’s a Ukrop’s cake!  When I first moved here, I thought this was an exaggeration, but when we’d host a party at work for any reason, the coordinator always had to have a cake from Ukrop’s— one bite is all it took…and I immediately understood why.

After the retail stores were closed, I was thrilled to hear that we would still be able to get Ukrop’s cake through MARTIN’S. Ukrop’s Homestyle Foods bakes tens of thousands of cakes for special occasions every year including birthdays, graduations, anniversaries, and, yes, even weddings.  Actually, there really isn’t an occasion necessary to enjoy that great-tasting, lip-smacking, finger-licking flavor: just treat yourself anytime and don’t feel guilty!

Haven’t had a Ukrop’s cake lately?  We can fix that.  We are giving away a gift card ($25 value) for a Ukrop’s Homestyle Foods cake to one lucky reader! ENTER HERE!

We’ll announce the winner by 3/10/11. Good luck!

[gallery link="file"]

item.title: Ukrop's and St. Patty's Day: A lucky combination.
item.dc:creator: user
item.content:encoded:
by Richmondmom.com's Kate Hall

There’s so much history that surrounds St. Patrick’s Day since it came to the United
States in 1737.

Some say St. Patrick gave a sermon from a hilltop that drove all the snakes from Ireland,
which is tough to believe, since no snakes were ever native to that country!

Originally St. Patrick’s Day was a holy Catholic day, but it’s evolved into a more secular
holiday in the United States.

Whatever your St. Patty’s Day tradition, it no doubt will include treats from Ukrop’s Homestyle Foods. Whether it’s a Killarney Jewel Cake (pictured here), once-a-year St. Patty’s Day cupcakes (also pictured, yum!) or cookies, or even a custom Ukrop’s cake with your favorite “lucky charm” on it—don’t forget to have some “home-baked” Ukrop’s goodness on your kitchen table.

[caption id="attachment_721" align="alignright" width="210" caption="Ukrop's St. Patty's Day Cupcakes. Now that's lucky."][/caption]

Our “little leprechauns” just love these treats found at Martin’s in Richmond. We are so lucky: there's no doubt.

Share your St. Patty’s Day traditions and Ukrop’s favorites—we’d love to hear about
them!

Source: www.wilstar.com/holidays/patrick.htm

item.title: Tell Mom you love her with a meal
item.dc:creator: user
item.content:encoded:
by Kate Willoughby Hall of Richmondmom.com

Out of all the precious gifts my children have made me—from the cut-out valentine hearts to the pipe-cleaner flowers---my favorite gifts are the times we’ve spent together in the kitchen.


[caption id="attachment_731" align="alignleft" width="300" caption="One of my most treasured gifts this year, other than my Ukrop's Homestyle foods goodies"][/caption]


It seems like even though it’s tough to get a meal together for my three little ones sometimes, the part where we get to sit down together and enjoy a few bites and talk about our day is the best reward.


This past Mother’s Day, as my kids asked me what I wanted, one thing that topped my list was a delicious dinner. One catch: it had to be one that I didn’t have to cook and did not require me going out to a crowded restaurant.

Two of my favorites from Ukrop’s Homestyle foods are the Ukrop’s Oven Bakes Baked Spaghetti and, of course, their Signature Long Stem Pink Rose Cake. That’s all they brought me, and I was happy as a clam. Happy Mother’s Day to all Richmond moms and grand moms out there, I hope it was relaxing, and delicious!

item.title: Ukrop's Sides are a mom's best friend
item.dc:creator: user
item.content:encoded:
by Kate Willoughby Hall of Richmondmom.com

Sometimes we can barely get ourselves out the door, let alone planning for dinner at night. With two full-time jobs, three kids in two different schools, and cub scouts and other activities…by the time I actually get to sit down at night, sadly the last thing I want to think about is dinner.

This is why Ukrop’s Homestyle Foods and Martin’s are my partners in feeding my family. Because I can pop into the store on the way to picking up my daughter from day care and grab a side of their famous Triple Cheese Macaroni and Cheese, Seasoned Green Beans, or Bacon and Cheddar Potatoes along with Grilled Chicken Breasts with BBQ sauce…and within minutes dinner is on the table.

Ukrop’s Homestyle Foods sides are always crowd-pleasers at my house and help me nourish my family when I don’t have a lot of time or imagination.

Now, for getting the kids to eat their vegetables. Well, that’s another story. We’ll keep you posted on that one!

item.title: The toughest decision I make some days: which Ukrop’s salad is my favorite
item.dc:creator: user
item.content:encoded:
by Kate Hall, Richmondmom.com

I had a work luncheon recently and knew exactly what to bring to please the crowd— Ukrop’s Chicken Salad with famous White House Rolls.  It’s funny, when Richmond folks see the Ukrop’s Homestyle Foods salad container, it’s a reassuring sign—like an old family friend that’s always there at every event.

Even though Martin’s purchased Ukrop’s Super Markets, the Ukrop’s brand is remains behind to reassure us all that the flavors we’ve grown to love are still here for us to enjoy!

Old Fashioned Potato Salad, Chicken Caesar Pasta Salad and Southern Watergate Salad are just a few of the amazing salads I take to luncheons or have on hand at the house for weekend get-togethers.

item.title: Gather Around the Blender - Fresh Cut Fruits Make Refreshing Summer Drinks
item.dc:creator: user
item.content:encoded: [caption id="attachment_1001" align="alignleft" width="226"] Visit your local MARTIN'S to see our wide selection of cut fruit to start begin making your own smoothies![/caption] As the summer weather continues to heat up, finding a cool and refreshing drink to help quench your thirst should not leave you bottled up!  No one doubts how easy it is to pick up a bottled soft drink, tea or a fruit juice, but you sometimes compromise in many areas including calories, sugars and fats while also contributing to more environmental waste due to empty cups and bottles.  Whether you want to start your day with a fresh smoothie, want a refreshing midday milkshake or an anytime is fine frozen fruit creation, incorporating Ukrop's Homestyle Foods fresh cut fruits is a great place to begin.  Our fresh cut fruit is gathered from select growers, we check sugar levels in the fruit daily to ensure optimum freshness and we also provide convenient sizes from our grab and go cups up to 3 lb. containers!  Watermelon, pineapple, melons and more provide a great foundation for a refreshing drink.  The Essentials:  Each drink should have a base of at least 1 cup of milk, yogurt, ice cream, crushed ice, juice or a banana to begin.  Make sure that your blender is capable of handling crushed ice before you combine the ingredients.  Fresh fruits provide wonderful flavor, but check to be sure that large seeds are extracted before use to make your drink smoother.  Use fruits that have different textures in order to make your drink more robust and do not be afraid to go with a single fruit or a mixture of fruits.  Complimentary groupings help you to bring a color and a little bit of variety to you summer drinks.  We suggest some of the following combinations:  Honeydew Melon with Cantaloupe, Mangoes with Oranges and Pineapples, or Mixed Berries including Strawberries, Raspberries, Blueberries and Blackberries.  Add a splash of citrus using either orange, lemon or lime juice to help layer your flavors.  Garnish in a nice reusable glass with a fresh mint leaf, whipped topping or granola.  Search online for great recipes to help you to get started or use your imagination!

item.title: Gather Around the Gridiron
item.dc:creator: user
item.content:encoded:
[gallery ids="1000,987,988" link="file"] Football season is already underway, and it’s a great time for families to gather around the gridiron.  Watching sports with your family can be an enjoyable experience as you cheer for your favorite teams, learn about historic moments in sports and spend quality time together!  It’s no secret that sports and food go great together, but watching a game doesn’t mean that you have to be on junk-food overload. 

 Ukrop’s Homestyle Foods prepares or makes a variety of great appetizers for small viewing parties with just the family—to big gatherings with friends and neighbors during major events. 

Spice up your routine and add some of our great game-day “starters!” 

  • Ukrop’s Homestyle Foods Spinach and Artichoke Dip

Enjoy a dip that’s a blend of spinach and artichokes combined with cheddar, Monterrey Jack and Parmesan cheeses.  Goes great with fresh pita, pita chips or water crackers; for an added touch serve it in hollowed-out artisan bread.  Chop the bread into cubes and watch it disappear!

  •  Ukrop’s Homestyle Foods Buffalo Chicken Dip

Get your chicken fix without messy bones to clean up!  Our great-tasting buffalo chicken dip is made with all white meat chicken, cream cheese, ranch dressing and flavorful spices!  We’ve kicked it up with hot sauce and topped it with cheddar cheese!  Serve with fresh veggies!

  •  Ukrop’s Homestyle Foods 7 Layer Dip

We’ve taken the guess work out with our hearty dip made with refried beans, guacamole, sour cream, black olives, shredded cheese and more!  Heat and eat and serve with our salsa and tortilla chips!

 Find these items are your local MARTIN’S store in our convenient pans that can be heated in the oven or the microwave!

item.title: Gather Around: Party in Pink
item.dc:creator: user
item.content:encoded:
[gallery columns="2" ids="996,992" link="file"] Preparing for parties can take some simple planning and a quick trip to the bakery at your local MARTIN'S.  Each season, new custom themed cupcakes are added to the selections and finding the one that is just right for your parties takes a few simple steps.  You can simply visit in the in-store bakery kiosk or better yet, search online and place your orders at any time of the day or night! 

For perfectly pink parties, plan to host a Hello Kitty collectible party and feature our pink/white custom Hello Kitty Cupcakes!  Invite guests to come dressed in pink, ask them to bring their favorite Hello Kitty themed item, and serve the cupcakes, strawberry flavored ice cream and pink lemonade!  Each cupcake comes with a great party favor already included to add to their collection!  Fans of the popular Pinkalicious children's book series can also think pink by ordering our custom Pinkalicious cupcakes!  Invite guests to bring their books and have a round robin storytime or arrange a book swap! 

Are you headed to a party and want to leave a perfectly pink impression?  Order a set of cupcakes and gift them to the host!

item.title: Gather Around: Breast Cancer Awareness
item.dc:creator: user
item.content:encoded: [gallery ids="998,997,999" link="file"] October may tickle you pink as you see signs of pink ribbons all around town.  The month, has for the past 25 years served as the primary starting point for the promotion of breast cancer awareness, information sharing on the disease and efforts to provide greater access to screening services.  Many people look for ways to show their support for this worthy cause through the purchase of items emblazoned with the pink ribbon.  At Ukrop's Homestyle Foods, we have prepared a suite of items design to show how much you care and each can be personalized with your own message.  From our delicious cupcakes to our beautiful cake to our new pink ribbon message cookie, finding just the right way to show how much you care is as easy as 1-2-3.  Find all three products at your local MARTIN'S bakery or order online.  While October is recognized as National Breast Cancer Awareness Month, the http://www.NBCAM.org Web site is a year-round resource for breast cancer patients, survivors, caregivers, and the general public. We encourage you to visit our site in October and regularly throughout the year as we add updated breast cancer information and resources.
