item.title: Gather Around: Holiday Fun with Ukrop's Homestyle Foods
item.dc:creator: user
item.content:encoded: [caption id="attachment_991" align="alignleft" width="300"] Enjoy our delcious Ukrop's Homestyle Foods Cupcakes with Peppermint Candies[/caption] The Christmas holidays can create food fun well into the New Year!  Finding creative and clever ways to recycle your leftover treats can lead to fun food projects that the entire family can enjoy! Peppermint Candy Cupcakes Each year do you look at broken and crumbled peppermint candy canes and wonder what to do with them?  Try this nifty trick with cupcakes that is easy to set-up and clean-up! Ingredients 1 six pack of Ukrop’s Homestyle Foods cupcakes with vanilla icing 1 six pack of Ukrop’s Homestyle Foods cupcakes with chocolate icing 1 cup of crumbled peppermint candy canes Place individual cupcakes on plates.  Have your kids take a teaspoonful of candy crumbles per cupcake.  Add the crumbles to the cupcake icing either by placing them in a pattern such as a monogram, a heart or a circular pattern.  For the more abstract food art fans, sprinkle on the crumbles in a free form design.  Serve for dessert or an afternoon snack!

item.title: Ukrop's Monument 10K Training Tips
item.dc:creator: user
item.content:encoded:
Keep your body fueled while you train for the 10K with lean sources of protein and complex carbohydrates. Ukrop’s Homestyle Foods Grilled Chicken Breast with Oven Roasted Vegetables is a tasty way to get 25 grams of protein for just 180 calories. Add a delicious Whole Wheat White House Roll to complete your meal and boost your intake of wholesome carbohydrates and fiber. Look for these great foods at your local Martin’s.
Be carb smart! Carbohydrates provide the needed fuel for your muscles during training. For optimal performance, include carbohydrate-rich foods with each meal and snack. Our Whole Wheat White House Rolls are made with a unique blend of whole wheat flour, oat bran and cracked wheat and provide 16 grams of carbohydrates and three grams of fiber per serving.
Training runs getting longer? Feeling tired? Be sure to refuel your body with a healthy lunch. Ukrop’s Homestyle Foods Oven Roasted Turkey Sub contains complex carbohydrates to replace muscle glycogen stores that are lost in longer distance running. To keep the calories and fat in check, simply remove the cheese and add a side of raw veggies.

item.title: Winning with White House Rolls!
item.dc:creator: user
item.content:encoded: [caption id="attachment_1020" align="alignnone" width="524"] Winning with White House Rolls![/caption] A customer favorite for decades, White House Rolls® have provided a unique and tasty base for some of the best sandwiches in town . These rolls were developed in the late 1940s in response to a quest for a perfect yeast roll. They were called White House Rolls because of the dusting of white flour when the rolls were panned—and because they were good enough to serve at The White House! These amazing rolls have become a staple in thousands of households across central Virginia and beyond.  The rolls are so versatile that they can be a part of every meal, from a breakfast bacon, egg and cheese to a lunchtime meal with Chicken Salad or served alongside your favorite meal at dinner.  In addition, White House Rolls also come in both a white and a wheat varieties making them even more enjoyable.  This year, White House Rolls became the official roll of the Ukrop's Monument Avenue 10K.  A winning combination, each participant to cross the finish line was given their own individual packet of White House Rolls!  Visit www.whitehouserolls.com and find out how we roll!  Tweet your favorite way to enjoy White House Rolls by using @ukrops #whrolls!

item.title: Voluntary Recall of Gingerbread Man Cookies
item.dc:creator: user
item.content:encoded:
NEWS RELEASE Ukrop’s Homestyle Foods Announces Voluntary Recall of Gingerbread Man Cookies Due to Possible Undeclared Allergen Contacts:  
Gary Larson        (804) 340-3196
Patrick Hadden  (804) 419-1964
Ukrop’s Homestyle Foods LLC today announced that, out of an abundance of caution, it is voluntarily recalling specific production lots of Gingerbread Man Cookies that may contain an undeclared milk allergen.  These affected products are produced at the company’s plant in Richmond, Virginia and are sold through MARTIN’S Foods retail grocery stores in Richmond and Williamsburg, Virginia.  There have been no known reports of illness associated with the use of this product. The only affected products are those labeled with the Gingerbread Man (2oz.) product name and a sell-by date between 11/8/12 and 12/16/12.  This product name and sell-by date is found on the front of each package.  Products that carry any other names and sell-by dates are not affected by this recall.  The presence of an ingredient containing milk in a food product may cause an allergic reaction in people with milk allergies or intolerance to milk. In this instance the milk may have been present in the icing used to secure the bottom of the cookie to the package.  “The safety of our customers who eat our products is our first priority, and this is why we are voluntarily taking this precautionary measure,” said Mr. Robert S. Ukrop, President of Ukrop’s Homestyle Foods.  The company advises consumers who have allergies to milk to return affected product to the point of purchase.  Consumers with questions about the recall or the product involved may contact Ukrop’s Homestyle Foods, LLC at (804)340-3000.  Instructions will be provided on how to determine whether consumers have affected products and, if so, what to do with the recalled product.  Ukrop’s Homestyle Foods founded in Richmond in 2010, operates a Bakery, Kitchen, and a distribution center. www.ukropshomestylefoods.com

item.title: Happy St. Patrick's Day!
item.dc:creator: user
item.content:encoded: Did you know Colonial New York City hosted the first official St. Patrick's Day parade in 1762, when Irish immigrants in the British colonial army marched down city streets? In subsequent years Irish fraternal organizations also held processions to St. Patrick's Cathedral. The various groups merged sometime around 1850 to form a single, grand parade. St. Patrick's Day is now widely celebrated in the United States...you're sure to see lots of green this Sunday, March 17! item.title: Mother Knows Best
item.dc:creator: user
item.content:encoded: This Sunday, May 12 is Mother’s Day, a celebration honoring mothers and motherhood. The official observance is credited to Anna Jarvis of Philadelphia, PA in 1907 as she honored the memory of her mother with a small gathering of friends in her home. The following year, Ms. Jarvis persuaded her mother's church in Grafton, WV to celebrate “Mother's Day” on the anniversary of her mother's death, the second Sunday of May. Ms. Jarvis and her supporters launched a grassroots campaign to establish a national Mother's Day to honor all mothers. By 1911, Mother's Day was widely celebrated across the country. In 1914, President Woodrow Wilson made it official: Mother's Day would be a national holiday held each year on the second Sunday in May. He said that mothers were "the greatest source of the country's strength and inspiration." It is the perfect day to gather around the table and say thanks to Mom...Happy Mother’s Day!

item.title: A Father's Day to Remember
item.dc:creator: user
item.content:encoded: The Ukrop’s Family Gathering has been an annual tradition for more than 50 years, bringing company associates and their families together for a day of picnic food, fun and fellowship. This year’s event will not soon be forgotten, thanks to a visit from a U.S. serviceman who surprised his family and created a lasting memory for all those in attendance. This was not Air Force Airman 1st Class Vicente Mendoza’s first Family Gathering. In fact, he won the pie-eating contest in 2011 and his sister won the same contest in 2012! Vicente’s father, Bonfilio, has been a Ukrop’s associate for 19 years. He and his family planned to attend the Family Gathering again this year, although without Vicente (or so they thought!), who has been in basic training in Texas prior to embarking on a two- year tour of duty in Japan in about two weeks. Vicente arranged an early arrival home and was a surprise special guest at the Family Gathering. His parents, sister and brother were all dockside as Vicente arrived on a pontoon boat. The family stood in amazement as they quickly realized it was their son and brother carrying the American flag on board as Toby Keith's “American Soldier” played over the loudspeaker! [gallery ids="1243,1225,1245,1232,1246,1266,1234,1264,1265"] After a warm welcome complete with lots of hugs and tears, Josh Groban’s “You Raise Me Up” was played, a special request from Vicente dedicated to his father. It was an emotional reunion for the family and a particularly touching tribute to Bonfilio leading up to Father’s Day. The song includes the following lyrics, which certainly reflects how many sons and daughters feel about their father: You raise me up, so I can stand on mountains; You raise me up, to walk on stormy seas; I am strong, when I am on your shoulders; You raise me up... To more than I can be. Thank you Mendoza family and Happy Father’s Day!

item.title: Mrs. Marshall's Salads and Sides
item.dc:creator: user
item.content:encoded: Mrs. Marshall’s fresh, delicious homemade salads—including her famous potato salad—have been a Richmond tradition since 1921. Since she introduced them at local grocers and delicatessens, they’ve become known for consistent quality and great taste. In 2005, the Ukrop family partnered with Mrs. Marshall’s and began producing the famous Potato Salad and Cole Slaw with the same love and attention to detail that the original family recipes required. Complementary items were also developed to provide new tastes for the many Mrs. Marshall’s fans. Today, Ukrop’s Homestyle Foods is honored to continue serving great-tasting Mrs. Marshall’s Potato Salad, Cole Slaw, Chicken Salad, BBQ, Pimento Cheese, Tuna Salad and Garden Pasta Salad. Make Mrs. Marshall’s part of your next family dinner, cookout or picnic and discover Richmond’s tastiest tradition, now available in local MARTIN'S locations and Kroger stores across Virginia.

item.title: Valentine Sugar Cookie Recipe
item.dc:creator: user
item.content:encoded:
From “The Words Worth Eating Cookbook”

“An easy February treat…crisp on the outside and slightly chewy inside.”

1 cup margarine or butter, softened 2 cups sugar, divided 2 egg yolks ¼ or ½ teaspoon salt 1 teaspoon soda 1 teaspoon cream of tartar 2 cups flour, measure before sifting 1 teaspoon almond extract Red sugar crystals (sprinkle on tops after baking for festive touch) Preheat oven to 325 degrees. Use an electric mixer on low speed to cream margarine or butter with 1 ½ cups of sugar; add egg yolks. Sift dry ingredients; mix with creamed sugar mixture. Add almond extract; mix well. Form into 1 inch balls and roll in remaining ½ cup sugar. Space balls two inches apart on ungreased cookie sheet. Do not flatten cookies. Bake 10-12 minutes. Remove from baking sheet while warm. Yield:  4 dozen. Note: Do not crowd cookies together since they spread while baking. Cookies will be soft when removed from oven, but will firm as they cool. Make ahead and freeze for Valentine parties.

item.title: Getting to Know Certified Executive Pastry Chef Jim Goodman!
item.dc:creator: user
item.content:encoded: Meet the very talented man who is behind many of Ukrop’s Homestyle Foods’ great-tasting desserts. A lover of Nutella, an illustrator, and a Marine are a just a few words to describe our very own Jim Goodman, who is originally from the San Francisco area. [caption id="attachment_1810" align="alignleft" width="333"] Meet Certified Executive Pastry Chef Jim Goodman![/caption] He entered the baking business quite by accident. In high school, he began working with Ukrop’s Super Markets in 1974 at Dumbarton Square as a courtesy clerk and cashier, graduated, and joined the Marine Corps. About this time, Ukrop’s purchased Dot’s Pastry Shop. Through a military occupation study, he ended up attending Baker’s School, where he was eventually cooking, baking, and driving. After being honorably discharged from the Marines, Jim came back to the area and worked as a delivery driver for Dot’s Pastry Shop. There were nine stores in 1980. After three months, he transitioned to the bakery, where he trained under master baker Bill Dvorak of Dot’s Pastry Shop. During this time, Jim completed the American Institute of Baking “Science and Baking” course. In 1990, Jim began training with Certified Master Pastry Chef (one of 17 in the United States at the time) Otto Bernet. Chef Bernet trained in Zurich, Switzerland, had won gold medals in the International Culinary Olympics, and was a renown chocolatier who joined the Ukrop’s team in 1989, introducing customers to European Specialties. Jim also became a member of the American Culinary Federation receiving his certification as an Executive Pastry Chef. Before becoming the head pastry chef in 2004, Jim wore just about every hat at Ukrop’s Bakery. He now creates specialty desserts and conducts research and development. Special projects are his favorite. He developed all of the Cakes of the Month at MARTIN’S, as well as the four layer cakes at Kroger. He was also involved in the early stages of our brand new Gender Reveal cake! During his amazing career, he’s won a gold and two silver medals at national culinary competitions, been the president of the Chef’s Association, made custom cakes for NASCAR drivers including Mark Martin, Terry Labonte, Jonny Benson and Greg Sacks, created the 1994 Republican National Convention Cake, and has made a number of cakes for former Virginia Governors George Allen and Mark Warner and former Senator Jim Webb. [caption id="attachment_1811" align="alignright" width="500"] Pictured is Chef Goodman throwing out the first pitch at a Richmond Flying Squirrels game![/caption] His most memorable cake was Mark Warner’s 2002 or 2003 birthday cake. Designed as a showpiece (meaning portions were not meant to be consumed), it had three-tiers of Styrofoam and a top layer of real cake. After the cake was rolled onto the stage, Senator Warner invited everyone to have some dessert, so everyone scurried back to the Governor’s Mansion! By working at Ukrop’s, Jim has learned something new every day and seen a lot of the United States in the process. The project that he had the most fun with was the creation of an exact replica of the Jim Beam village in Frankfurt, Kentucky from chocolate, sugar and German gingerbread. This showpiece took an entire month to create. When asked if he has an advice for aspiring pastry chefs, Jim said health and creativity are important. “Baking is chemistry,” said Goodman. “It’s math, reading and comprehension. Pick your school based on your goals!” Fun facts: His favorite ingredient to make desserts with is chocolate, and he loves his White House Rolls with London Broil!

item.title: Celebrating Family Recipes for National Grandparents Day
item.dc:creator: user
item.content:encoded:
Sunday, September 13 is National Grandparents Day. Some of the best recipes come from our parents, grandparents and great-grandparents. At Ukrop's Homestyle Foods, we're proud to use family recipes for our products.

In honor of this day, we would like to share a Lebanese recipe from our CFO, John Zeheb, that has been passed down in his family for many years now. These delicious cookies are typically made during the holidays.

[caption id="attachment_1828" align="aligncenter" width="500"] Pictured is John and his Granddaughter, Kristen.[/caption]

Fruit Cocktail Cookies

In A Mixer, Blend:

[caption id="attachment_1822" align="alignright" width="275"] Fruit Cocktail Cookies[/caption]

1 cup shortening, 1 ½ cups sugar, 3 eggs, 3 tablespoons molasses, 1teaspoon salt, 1 teaspoon vanilla, 1 teaspoon cloves and 1 tablespoon cinnamon

Dissolve together:

1 teaspoon baking soda, 2 tablespoons water

 Add 4 cups of flour, then blend.

Add & Mix By Hand:

1 cup chopped walnuts, 1 cup raisins and 1 17oz. can of fruit cocktail (no juice)

Spoon cookie batter on cookie sheet, bake for 11 minutes at 375 degrees then enjoy!

Do you have a favorite recipe that was passed on from your grandparents? Share it with us!

item.title: Meet Sam Dortch, National Sales Manager for Ukrop's Homestyle Foods
item.dc:creator: user
item.content:encoded: A few questions with Sam Dortch, National Sales Manager for Ukrop's Homestyle Foods! Read on to get to know Sam and find out some exciting news from Ukrop's.   How did you decide to become interested in Sales? After graduating from college, I began my career in advertising, working at The Martin Agency for a year. It turned out, my roommate's girlfriend's father owned a food brokerage firm that specialized in grocery products. It piqued my interest, so I took the job and stayed there for 10 years - working with everything from ketchup to ice cream. What attracted you to the food industry? It was by chance really! It's fun, and I really enjoy always being on the leading edge of new trends in food - not to mention that all of the free samples are great and my kids really enjoy them, too! How long have you been with Ukrop's? I called on Ukrop's as a sales representative initially; then I joined the company in 2007 as a Frozen Dairy Category Manager. I left when the stores sold and moved on to SuperValu as a category manager. My heart must have been here, because I came back to Ukrop's in 2012. What do you most enjoy about working for Ukrop's? The people! It's a great group of folks. Everyone bends over backwards to help our customers. I really enjoy being a part of the development for products, too, from the idea to the tasting to the selling in stores. It's a great process! What's your food from Ukrop's Homestyle Foods? It changes all the time - every month in fact! Right now, it's the Cinnamon Crumb Coffee Cake we sell to Kroger under the Good Meadow brand. Last month, it was our traditional Pound Cake sold at MARTIN'S. What is a typical work day for you? It varies whether I am in the office or traveling. If I'm in the office, it's catching up on requests from customers and items being developed, as well as meeting with the packaging team. If I'm on the road, it's usually a sales call, working with a broker representative or handing out White House Rolls at different demos in military commissaries. Can you talk about our partnerships? We have a really unique relationship with our customers (retailers). Ukrop's Homestyle Foods is their solution for top quality items that you can't find elsewhere. We have expanded our retailers now and are selling foods to MARTIN'S, Kroger, The Fresh Market, Harris Teeter and Military Commissaries, just to name a few. Any exciting news or updates you can share with us? We are very excited to announce that White House Rolls will be available in BJ's Wholesale Club by the end of October... just in time for the holidays! Stay tuned for more information. What do you do in your spare time? When I’m not attending my kids sporting events or shuttling them back and forth to their friend’s houses, I can usually be found relaxing around my own house or tending to my new beehive!  My father was a beekeeper when I was younger, and I recently decided to give it a try. This past Spring I purchased my first hive and have enjoyed working with them all summer (other than the occasional sting... ouch; I do carry an EpiPen now)!  The bee population has exploded (approx. 60,000 bees now), and I am close to harvesting my first batch of honey.  If all goes as planned, they’ll survive their first winter and my honey production will be off the charts next Spring! How do you like your White House Roll? Toasted with butter and country ham!

item.title: 26th Annual Valor Awards
item.dc:creator: user
item.content:encoded: Last Friday, we honored our local community's heroes - our First Responders and their families - at the Retail Merchants Association's 26th Annual Valor Awards. We heard the stories of 25 brave and selfless First Responders who were honored for their courageous acts of valor. This was the largest event in its 26 years history - with 900 attendees - at the Greater Richmond Convention Center. What made it particularly special was having the opportunity to actually meet the heroes and their families. In our conversations with the honorees, we found out that two of the recipients were actually Former Ukrop's Associates! It has been our pleasure to be a title sponsor of this event for many years now, and we are already looking forward to next year. Thank you, First Responders, for keeping us safe and for going above and beyond the call of duty. We are so grateful!

item.title: Sitting down with Top Chef, Thomas Pearce
item.dc:creator: user
item.content:encoded: Thomas Pearce first knew he wanted to be a chef at the age of 15 when he began working (with a permit, of course) as a prep cook and dishwasher at a diner in Charlottesville. After using with the French fry fryer, he just knew preparing food for others was what he wanted to do. He later trained at the prestigious Culinary Institute of America in Hyde Park, NY and developed a passion for French cooking and classical cuisine. The techniques, styles and the freshness drew him to this philosophy of cooking. Thirty-one years later, he still loves his job! He has been with Ukrop's for 19 years now. Just as he was drawn to French cooking, Tom was similarly attracted to Jim & Bobby Ukrop's philosophies for high-quality, fresh-ingredient foods. As the Executive Chef of Ukrop's Homestyle Foods, he is involved in training, research and development, daily production, quality control, and best practices in the kitchen and production. He loves to create, train, innovate, teach and cook. You can often find him in the test kitchen. As if that's not enough, he also develops or writes recipes - to date, it's over 500! He most enjoys working with his fellow associates at Ukrop's. "They are an unbelievable group of folks. Pearce said, "They work hard and are very helpful." His favorite ingredient is butter - it enriches the product, adds flavor and texture, and is great for soups and sauces. When asked about his most memorable cooking experience, Tom shared that it was when he was working as a Banquet Chef at the Commonwealth Club in 1990 and had the opportunity to prepare food for Certified Master Chef Ferdinand Metz of the Culinary Institute of America. Tom's advice for aspiring chefs is to cook because you love it! "Cook because it is in your heart and soul," said Pearce. Don't forget formalized education and classes because you build a foundation and also learn as you work, as well as learn from people you work with. His advice to customers at home striving to become better cooks is to "Cook because you want to be creative!" Fun facts: His favorite item is the seasonal Smoked Sausage and Black Eyed Pea Soup, which was inspired by his mom! He enjoys White House Rolls Bread Pudding, with White House Rolls (of course), white chocolate and dried cranberries. Yum!

item.title: A Holiday Recipe for You!
item.dc:creator: user
item.content:encoded:
Ukrop's Bakery Coconut Custard Pie

Made the same way Dot's Pastry Shop did! A wonderful recipe, from the "Celebrating with Ukrop's Great Food" Cookbook, for Thanksgiving or Christmas to be shared with friends and loved ones. This recipe is fairly similar to your favorite Coconut Custard Pie recipe from Ukrop's Homestyle Foods. Ingredients:
  • 1/2 cup butter
  • 1/3 cup light Karo syrup
  • 1 2/3 cups sugar
  • 1/2 teaspoon salt
  • 6 tablespoons cornstarch
  • 1/2 cup very hot water
  • 5 eggs
  • 1 1/2 teaspoons vanilla
  • 1 1/4 cups desicated coconut (Desicated coconut is small cut and dry. If not available, use 1 cup of flake coconut)
  • 1 deep 9-inch pie shell or 3 8-inch shells
  In a double boiler, heat butter and syrup until butter melts. In a mixing bowl, mix sugar and salt; set aside. In a separate bowl, dissolve cornstarch in milk. Add milk mixture to sugar mixture and mix with electric mixture on low speed. When mixed, increase speed to high and mix until smooth. Add very hot water and mix on medium speed; add butter mixture. Mix on low speed until incorporated. Break eggs in a separate bowl; whisk by hand. Slowly stir eggs and vanilla in by hand, taking care not to add air to the mixture. Measure coconut; add slowly until incorporated. Fill pie shells and place in a preheated oven at 350 degrees. As soon as pies are placed in the oven, reduce heat to 340 degrees. Bake about 35 minutes or until pies have a "Jello" ripple if gently shaken. Be sure not to whip air into the pie during the final stages. Pies will have a golden tan color when baked. Allow to cool and enjoy a real treat. Yields 2 9-inch or 3 8-inch pies. Enjoy!

item.title: Making an Easy, Southwestern Summer Salad
item.dc:creator: user
item.content:encoded:
It’s hot, hot, hot! Enjoy a light, easy salad for two, with a 20-minute prep time this summer. You’re going to love it! Ingredients: Ukrop’s Seasoned Grilled Chicken Breast Strips (available at MARTIN’S) Romaine Lettuce A bag of Frozen Corn Spicy Black Beans - Can Cherubs Tomatoes Avocado Shredded Mexican Cheese Tortilla Strips Ranch Dressing Steps:  1. Place the corn in a steamer basket, in a pan, on the stove. Heat on high. At the same time, place the can of bans in a pan on the stove. Heat on medium (until warm).  

2. Slice the avocados and tomatoes.

3. Once the corn and beans are done, place lettuce in serving bowls. Pour beans on top of the lettuce.

4. Place the Ukrop’s Seasoned Grilled Chicken Breast Strips, Corn, Tomatoes, Avocado, and Tortilla Strips on top of the lettuce and black beans.

5. Sprinkle Mexican Cheese on the salad and drizzle with Ranch Dressing.

Enjoy!

Do you have a favorite summer salad recipe? Share it with us in the comments below!

item.title: Life's a beach!
item.dc:creator: user
item.content:encoded: Bring the beach to you with these festive cupcakes... A great (and easy) cupcake decorating activity for the whole family! Ingredients:  Ukrop's Yellow Batter Cupcakes Iced White Graham Crackers Teddy Grahams Swedish Fish AirHeads Life Savers Gummies Betty Crocker Candy Shop Decors Blue Rock Candy Betty Crocker Decorating Decors Blue Sugar Blue Gummi Sharks   Steps: Crush up Graham Crackers to resemble sand.   Sprinkle the "sand" on half of the cupcake.   Add the Blue Rock Candy to the other half of the cupcake for the ocean. All of the pieces may not stick, so you might have to push some into the icing.     To make even more waves, sprinkle the Betty Crocker Decorating Decors Blue Sugar on the side with the blue rock candy.   Now you can really get creative! Break up an AirHead for a beach towel and place it on the sand.     Then place a Teddy Graham on the Beach Towel.   Go fish! Add Swedish Fish to the Ocean.   Or you can put a Gummi Shark in the ocean, instead of the fish.   You can back back a few steps and instead of the beach towel, place a Teddy Graham into a Life Saver. Or you can do both!     Mix and match them together. Have fun and be creative. The best part... They taste even better! Enjoy.

item.title: It's National Key Lime Pie Day!
item.dc:creator: user
item.content:encoded:
We're not celebrating with pie - instead we're making DIY Key Lime Cupcakes! It's a piece of cake to make this Key Lime Topping and the whole family is going to love them. Ingredients:
  • 1 Tablespoon of Lime Juice
  • One Lime
  • 1/2 Cup of Powdered Sugar
  • 1/4 Teaspoon of Vanilla Extract (We used Sauer's)
  • Graham Crackers
  • Ukrop's Cupcakes
    Steps: 1. Mix together Lime Juice, Powered Sugar and Vanilla Extract. 2. Drizzle Lime Topping over Cupcakes.   3. Crush up the Graham Crackers and sprinkle them on top of the Cupcakes.   4. Zest a lime and add a piece or two to the top of the cupcake.   5. Enjoy!

item.title: A 15-Minute Dinner for the Whole Family
item.dc:creator: user
item.content:encoded:
Fall is a such a busy time of the year. We understand how moments around the dinner table are so special, so we work hard to cook delicious meals that your family can enjoy together. We've taste-tested this pasta recipe - it's delicious and takes about 15 minutes - allowing you to spend extra family time. September is National Family Meals month, something that we keep in mind not only in September, but each day of the year. Enjoy and let us know how your family likes Meatloaf Spaghetti! Ingredients:
  • Ukrop's Old-Fashioned Meatloaf
  • 1 Package of Spaghetti
  • 1 Jar of Pasta Sauce
  • If desired, a 1/2 cup of Parmesan Cheese
  • If desired, fresh basil as a garnish
  Steps: 1. Add salted water to a pot and bring it to a boil. 2. Pour Pasta Sauce into another pan. Cut the Ukrop's Meatloaf into small pieces and add to the pan with the Pasta Sauce. 3. Cook pasta according to the instructions on the package. 4. Mix together the pasta sauce and the meatloaf and cook on medium heat. 5. Drain the pasta and place in the serving dish. Top the pasta with the meatloaf and sauce. 6. If desired, sprinkle parmesan cheese on top. 7. Add basil as a garnish and serve immediately. Bon appetit!
